availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Commodore P. Oldham (Hopkins Co. wagoner, farmer, pvt. 17th Ky Cav.)

body.p: Hopkins County, Kentucky, farmer, wagoner, and soldier. Kentucky native. Wagoner in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1863. Farmer in Hopkins County in 1864. Served in the 17th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from January 3, 1865, to September 20, 1865.

ab.bibl:
"Commodore Oldham (1841-1869)," Find A Grave, Memorial #108663791, accessed October 29, 2020, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/108663791.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0140.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War) NARA RG 110, Hopkins County, KY, December 1863, p. 144.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 405.
